subject: Real Estate
title: WeWork's $47 Billion Implosion
description: A short lesson to help you apply WeWork's $47 Billion Implosion.

hook.text: WeWork leased $47 billion worth of office space and convinced investors it was a tech company, not a landlord.

buildup.text: CEO Adam Neumann signed long-term leases and rented desks short-term, pocketing the spread.

discovery.text: SoftBank valued WeWork at $47 billion â€” more than most real estate empires with actual profits.

twist.text: The IPO filing revealed massive losses. The valuation collapsed from $47 billion to $8 billion in weeks.

climax.text: WeWork filed for bankruptcy in 2023. Neumann walked away with $245 million. Investors lost billions.

punchline.text: A glorified landlord fooled Silicon Valley for years.

quiz.question: Why did WeWork's valuation collapse?
options: The IPO filing revealed massive losses
